intent: Updated docs to use coffee-bean color theme in Tailwind
reasoning_trace:
The user requested updating the docs to use a specific coffee-bean color palette with CSS custom properties ranging from 50 (lightest: #fce9ef) to 950 (darkest: #1f040e).

Changes made:
1. Updated Tailwind CDN inline config to include the full coffee-bean color palette (50-950)
2. Set primary color to #e01f62 (coffee-bean-500) and secondary to #b4184f (coffee-bean-600)
3. Updated the hero gradient from purple/violet (#667eea → #764ba2) to coffee-bean tones (#e01f62 → #5a0c27)
4. Replaced all gray-* utility classes with corresponding coffee-bean-* classes:
   - bg-gray-900 → bg-coffee-bean-950 (darkest backgrounds)
   - bg-gray-800 → bg-coffee-bean-900 (section backgrounds)
   - border-gray-800/700 → border-coffee-bean-800/700
   - text-gray-100/200/300/400/500/600 → text-coffee-bean-50/100/200/300/400

The coffee-bean palette is actually a warm magenta/rose color scheme despite its name, creating a distinctive pink-toned dark theme.

Trade-offs:
- Pro: Consistent theming across the entire page using a single color palette
- Pro: The dark tones (900-950) provide good contrast for readability
- Con: Lost the green accent color (text-green-400) for positive table values, now uses same coffee-bean-300 as other text

Warning: The code-block class still uses a hardcoded dark background (#1e1e2e) which doesn't match the coffee-bean palette. This was intentional to maintain good code readability with syntax highlighting, but could be updated to use coffee-bean-950 for more consistency.

rejected_alternatives.name: Using CSS custom properties directly instead of Tailwind config - would require more refactoring
Keeping green accent for positive table values - decided consistency was more important
Updating code-block background to match theme - kept dark neutral for better code readability
